meanings.definition: A person who observes a process or activity to ensure that it is carried out correctly.
meanings.sent1: The monitors at the event made sure everyone followed the rules.
meanings.sent2: The security monitors watched the cameras to keep the building safe.
meanings.sent3: The monitors at the zoo had a fun job watching the animals play.
meanings.sent4: She was like a monitor in a movie, overseeing the scene with a critical eye.
meanings.sent5: The monitors in the control room were like silent guardians, ensuring everything ran smoothly.

meanings.definition: A device used to display information or data.
meanings.sent1: The computer monitors in the office show important emails and messages.
meanings.sent2: The heart rate monitor beeped steadily during the patient's check-up.
meanings.sent3: The baby monitor helped the parents keep an ear on their sleeping child.
meanings.sent4: The monitor on the wall acted like a window into the digital world.
meanings.sent5: The security guard glanced at the monitor to see who was at the door.

meanings.definition: To keep track of, check, or regulate something.
meanings.sent1: She monitors her plant's growth by measuring it every week.
meanings.sent2: The teacher monitors the students' progress in the class.
meanings.sent3: He monitors his spending to make sure he doesn't overspend.
meanings.sent4: The app monitors your daily steps to help you stay active.
meanings.sent5: The scientist monitors the experiment closely to record any changes.
